title: Review: The Super Mario Bros. Movie is a madcap love letter to fans
description: Who needs a plot? This roller coaster of a movie made my inner 10-year-old jump for joy.

title: After the death of Stadia, VP Phil Harrison has left Google
description: There's now nothing left of Google's once-grand gaming ambitions.

title: How Pink Floyd inspired research into medieval monks and volcanology
description: Study combines medieval European, Middle Eastern texts with ice core and tree ring data

title: Operation Cookie Monster: Feds seize “notorious hacker marketplace”
description: Genesis Market sold user data and a tool that mimics each victim's web browser.

title: Meta introduces AI model that can isolate and mask objects within images
description: "Segment Anything" model uses image segmentation to isolate objects on command.

title: Kobo’s $400 Elipsa 2E jumps into the “big e-readers with a pen” fight
description: Kobo is also introducing an $8-a-month service offering unlimited books.

title: Dealmaster: New low on Mac mini, Samsung 980 Pro, and Amazon Fire Kids; plus AirPods and iPad
description: $100 off the 2023 entry-level Mac mini is the steepest discount we've seen to date.

title: Outrage over white-only job ad drives tech firm to delete website
description: Company claims an ex-employee added discriminatory language to the job ad.

title: Ram goes for an oversized battery to give EV truck 500 miles of range
description: The production Ram 1500 REV looks more normal than the CES show truck.

title: Motorola still makes flagship phones: Meet the Edge 40 Pro
description: It has an interesting desktop mode and a terrible update cadence.

title: Best Buy starts selling mail-in tech recycling boxes
description: Retailer joins Apple, HP, and more in offering mail-in electronics recycling.

title: A New Zealand company has started flying a rocket-powered spaceplane
description: "Once we get our certification, we're allowed to fly as frequently as we want."

title: OpenAI threatened with landmark defamation lawsuit over ChatGPT false claims
description: ChatGPT falsely claimed a mayor went to prison.

title: Musk expands feud with media by labeling NPR Twitter account “state-affiliated”
description: Twitter changes policy to exclude NPR but hasn't fully scrubbed the old language.

title: President Biden delivers remarks on “risks of artificial intelligence”
description: When asked if AI is dangerous, Biden said, "It remains to be seen. It could be."

title: Miles Morales must make a sacrifice in Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse trailer
description: "Wait a minute! There's an elite crew with all the best Spider-People in it?"

title: Other than Tesla, which car companies are selling lots of EVs?
description: As automakers report Q1 sales, we take a look at the numbers.

title: Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure face antitrust probe
description: Ofcom "particularly concerned" over practices of tech giants that dominate cloud market

title: Review: AMD Ryzen 7800X3D is the cheapest way to get the most out of a $1,500 GPU
description: The X3D series isn't perfect, but it pairs well with top-tier graphics cards.

title: ChatGPT vs Google Bard: Which is better? We put them to the test.
description: We compare two top AI language models in seven categories to pick a winner.
